subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Share your stories for the press...?
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
All the EVP I've gotten seem to be from spirits who were human at one 
time. What Frank and others have been getting on Frank's boxes or the RS 
hacks could be anybody's guess, but they appear to be communicating ideas 
we can understand.

The most threatening thing I've ever heard was in a site where there were 
possibly many ghosts.  Many people had died there.  One voice simply said 
"Leave this building!" in a stern voice.

Yet, at the same location, someone asked if they wanted us to leave and a 
different voice said "You just got here."

Go figure.

Zack


On Tue, 2 Dec 2008, black bear hollow wrote:

> Ditto to all you said Margaret, and I'll further add that many times people
> record all sorts of voices that we would consider "non-human". I'm not sure 
> why people
> insist on stereotyping voices. Probably the ridiculous shows on the Travel & 
> Sci Fi Channels and superstitious religious
> dogma.
>
> There are many dimensions and Multiverses around us. No one can judge a voice 
> based on it's sound,
> tone, or anything else. It's too bad the media can't simply report on the 
> incredibly fascinating
> research we are doing without wanting creepy drama.
>
> w.
> On Dec 2, 2008, at 6:38 PM, itcdeadpeople wrote:
>
>> For whom do you write? Where can we read some of your previously
>> published material?? Based on your question, I'm assuming you aren't
>> looking to do the field of EVP/ITC or other paranormal research any
>> favors. What is your intention???
>> 
>> How about focusing on something positive? That would be a nice change
>> of pace from the media. I don't think you'll find anyone here that is
>> willing to help perpetuate the negative stereotypical views on our
>> research or other nonsense that is a distraction from the fact that
>> there are valuable EVP/ITC advances taking place.
>> 
>> Margaret
>> 
>> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "dmikolay" <dmikolay@...> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Anyone ever get an elemental, demon, or otherwise "inhuman" voice?
>> Anyone hear from
>>> someone with a dire warning? Anything else otherwise weird? I am a
>> journalist and would
>>> LOVE to interview you about it!
>>> 
>> 
>> 
>> 
>
